data_center.highlight: Record quarterly Data Center revenue, driven by Blackwell

impact_summary: Non-GAAP excludes stock-based compensation, acquisition-related costs, and gains/losses from equity securities
H20 charges/releases were insignificant in Q3 FY26

revenue.notes: Assumes continued momentum without H20 shipments to China

operating_expenses.notes: Full-year expense growth expected in the high-30% range

other_income_expense.notes: Excludes gains/losses from non-marketable and publicly-held equity securities

data_center: Record Data Center revenue of $51.2B, up 25% sequentially and 66% year-over-year
Blackwell scored top performance on SemiAnalysis InferenceMAX and every MLPerf Training/Infernce v5.1 benchmark
Partnerships with OpenAI (10+ GW), Google Cloud, Microsoft, Oracle, xAI, and Anthropic have scaled the NVIDIA AI factory
Announcing Rubin CPX GPUs, NVQLink open architecture, NVLink Fusion with Arm, Spectrum-X Ethernet deployments, and BlueField-4/AI-RAN stack to support AI factories worldwide
Building sovereign clouds in the U.K., Germany, the U.S. (Solstice/Equinox), and South Korea with partners such as CoreWeave, Deutsche Telekom, Nokia, Hyundai, Samsung, and T-Mobile
gaming: Gaming revenue of $4.3B, down 1% sequentially but up 30% year-over-year, led by Blackwell-powered RTX 50-series
Launches include Borderlands 4, Battlefield 6, ARC Raiders with DLSS 4 and NVIDIA Reflex, plus RTX Remix enhancements and new AI PC blueprints
professional_visualization: Revenue of $760M, up 26% sequentially and 56% year-over-year
Began shipping DGX Spark™ micro-supercomputers to deliver NVIDIA AI stacks in compact form factors
automotive_robotics: $592M in Automotive & Robotics revenue, up 1% sequentially and 32% year-over-year
Introduced DRIVE AGX Hyperion 10, partnered with Uber on level 4 mobility, and launched IGX Thor™ for real-time physical AI
Supported Omniverse digital twins via PTC/Siemens and scaled robotics collaborations spanning Agility, Amazon, Caterpillar, Foxconn, Toyota, and more
shareholder_actions: $37.0B returned to shareholders year-to-date via buybacks and dividends
Next dividend of $0.01 per share payable December 26, 2025
highlights.cfo_commentary: Detailed comments from Colette Kress are available at https://investor.nvidia.com.
highlights.conference_call: Live webcast and call scheduled at 2 p.m. PT (5 p.m. ET) on the release date; replay available until the Q4 FY26 call.
highlights.non_gaap_measures_summary: Non-GAAP metrics exclude stock-based compensation, acquisition-related costs, gains/losses from equity securities, interest amortization, and the minimal H20 charge/release impact.
